sentence.Network_en: Nick's head bent slowly over hers until their mouths met.
sentence.Network_cn: 尼克慢慢向她低下头去，直到他们的嘴唇碰在了一起。

sentence.Network_en: No one wants to employ somebody who bad-mouths their former employer.
sentence.Network_cn: 没有人愿意雇用说前雇主坏话的人。

sentence.Network_en: He made mouths at his mother and then ran out.
sentence.Network_cn: 他冲他妈妈做完鬼脸之后就跑出去了.

before a cake is brought on the table , eight mouths contend in beauty and fascination to see which one can get the large cake coated in butter . mouths work with effort to reveal the truth .在蛋糕端上桌之前，八张嘴巴争奇斗艳，看谁含住那块裹满奶油的大蛋糕，嘴们齐力断金，真相大白。

entry.def: Your mouth is the area of your face where your lips are or the space behind your lips where your teeth and tongue are.

example.ex: She clamped her hand against her mouth...
His mouth was full of peas.

entry.def: You can say that someone has a particular kind of mouth to indicate that they speak in a particular kind of way or that they say particular kinds of things.

example.ex: I've always had a loud mouth, I refuse to be silenced...
example.tran: 我一贯大声说出自己的想法，不会迫于压力而一言不发。

example.ex: You've got such a crude mouth!

entry.def: The mouth of a cave, hole, or bottle is its entrance or opening.

example.ex: By the mouth of the tunnel he bent to retie his lace.
example.tran: 到隧道出入口时，他弯腰重新系好鞋带。

entry.def: The mouth of a river is the place where it flows into the sea.

example.ex: ...the town at the mouth of the River Dart.
example.tran: 位于达特河入海口的城镇

entry.tran: 不出声地说;用口型默示
entry.def: If you mouth something, you form words with your lips without making any sound.

example.ex: I mouthed a goodbye and hurried in behind Momma...
example.tran: 我用口型默示告别，然后匆匆跟在妈妈身后走了进去。

example.ex: She winked broadly at him and silently mouthed something...
example.tran: 她使劲冲他使眼色，不出声地对他说了些什么。

entry.tran: 言不由衷地说；信口说；不知所云地说
entry.def: If you mouth something, you say it, especially without believing it or without understanding it.

example.tran: 我言不由衷地说了一些表示同情的客套话。

example.ex: They mouthed the values of family, religion and charity, but demonstrated the opposite in their private lives.
example.tran: 他们大谈家庭、宗教和慈善的价值，但他们在个人生活中的表现却恰恰相反。

entry.tran: 需要赡养的人;要养活的人
entry.def: If you have a number of mouths to feed, you have the responsibility of earning enough money to feed and look after that number of people.

example.ex: He had to feed his family on the equivalent of four hundred pounds a month and, with five mouths to feed, he found this very hard.
example.tran: 他要用相当于400英镑的月收入来维持五口之家的生计，感觉很艰难。

entry.def: If you say that someone does not open their mouth, you are emphasizing that they never say anything at all.

example.ex: Sometimes I hardly dare open my mouth...
example.tran: 有时我几乎不敢开口说话。

example.ex: He hasn't opened his mouth since he's been there.
example.tran: 他从到那儿后一直没有开口。

entry.def: If you keep your mouth shut about something, you do not talk about it, especially because it is a secret.

example.ex: You wouldn't be here now if she'd kept her mouth shut.
example.tran: 如果她守口如瓶的话，你现在就不会在这儿啦。

auth_sentence.content: Forget everything that comes out of the bands mouths.

auth_sentence.res_content: One or two...giggled with hands to their helpless mouths.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: One or two...giggled with hands to their helpless mouths.

auth_sentence.content: The Delta and its mouths posed obstacles to invaders.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Delta and its mouths posed obstacles to invaders.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Delta and its mouths posed obstacles to invaders.

Sentence.sentence: This means that there could be an extra three billion mouths to feed by the end of the century, a period in which substantial changes are anticipated in the wealth, calorie intake and dietary preferences of people in developing countries across the world.
